2.title: Roche Ups ADC Bet With $1B in Biobucks for Oxford BioTherapeutics
2.snippet: Roche's up to $1 billion investment will provide access to Oxford BioTherapeutics' antibody-drug conjugate platform for undisclosed cancer targets.
2.content:
Roche has inked an immuno-oncology partnership with U.K.-based Oxford BioTherapeutics with an eye toward developing best-in-class antibody-based treatments for cancer.

The pharma will pay $36 million upfront and has promised future milestone payments that could potentially go beyond $1 billion, according to a Wednesday announcement. Oxford will also be eligible for royalties on net sales of products that arise from the partnership.

In return, Roche will gain access to Oxford’s OGAP-Verify platform, a proprietary database on membrane protein abundance, with around 7,000 cataloged proteins across solid and hematological cancers and healthy tissues. The library is used to identify cancer targets that Oxford says would have otherwise been missed, as well as to predict a drug candidate’s potential efficacy and toxicity.

The partners will leverage the OGAP-Verify technology to discover and validate potential cancer targets, according to the agreement. Roche will be responsible for further development, as well as regulatory and commercialization activities, for any program that it chooses to take forward. The partners have yet to disclose what their priority diseases are, only revealing in the press announcement that they are going after “multiple selected novel oncology indications.”

With Wednesday’s Oxford partnership, Roche dives deeper into the ADC space. The pharma has two ADCs on the market: Polivy, indicated for specific types of lymphoma, and Kadcyla for the treatment of certain breast cancers.

Roche opened 2025 with an up to $1 billion licensing deal with Innovent, gaining access to the Chinese biotech’s anti-DLL3 ADC, which is in a Phase I study for small cell lung cancer.

A year earlier, in January 2024, Roche likewise turned to China for a cancer ADC, this time from Suzhou-headquartered MediLink Therapeutics. For $50 million upfront and the promise of around $1 billion in future payments, Roche secured rights to YL211, a c-MET-targeting ADC for solid tumors.

3.title: Agreement reached between state leaders, rideshare companies on Logan Airport pick-ups, drop-offs
3.snippet: BOSTON (WHDH) - State leaders reached an agreement with major rideshare companies regarding new rules and prices for pick-ups and drop-offs at Logan Airport...
3.content:
BOSTON (WHDH) - Massport voted Thursday to approve an increase of fees on rideshare companies for trips to and from Boston’s Logan International Airport.

That cost will be passed onto passengers and included in their ride fares. Massport agreed to terms with Uber and Lyft, saying the fees will improve access to rideshares and reduce traffic in the area.

A one-time trip fee will increase from $3.25 to $5.50 starting July 1.

“I think it’s terrible. Right now is not the time, the economy is not in its best shape right now,” traveler Jessica Shaw said. “I would — honestly, to save money — try any other way than taking an Uber. But, Ubers are convenient, so I see why people would want to pay that price, but honestly, if they do consider raising the prices, I think people are going to stop taking Ubers.”

Officials say extra funding will make it possible for expanded curbside access for riders as well.

Uber and Lyft will also add options for shared rides to cut down on the number of cars on the road, with a fee of only $1.50.

While some passengers were not happy with the decision, others said paying an increased rideshare fare is still better than paying to park.

“I’m okay with that. I feel like they’re giving me something I need, and I don’t want to mess with getting my car, so I’ll still pay for it,” said Julie Taylor.

(Copyright (c) 2024 Sunbeam Television. All Rights Reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed.)

4.title: Naples ups insurance to reduce risk, cover replacement, reconstruction
4.snippet: To eliminate insurance risk, Naples reappraised 40 city sites at $195.4 million and increased coverage to fully pay the cost of replacement and rebuilding...
4.content:
To eliminate insurance risk, Naples reappraised 40 city sites at $195.4 million and increased coverage to fully pay the cost of replacement and rebuilding after a hurricane or other disaster.

City Council voted March 19 to increase the sites’ insurable value from $167,711,263 to $195,413,719. The vote allows payment to Brown & Brown Inc. for a prorated additional insurance premium of $105,000 from March 19 through Sept. 30. Before the appraisal last year, Council approved renewing insurance from Oct. 1 through Sept. 30 through Lake Mary-based Preferred Government Insurance Trust, with a $1.495 million annual premium.

“The last comprehensive property appraisal of all city structures was completed in 2019 and Preferred required a comprehensive on-site property appraisal,” Deputy Human Resources Director Lori McCullers wrote in a memo to Council. “Every three to seven years, Preferred requires updated values.”

Preferred contracted with Pittsburgh-based Centurisk to conduct an on-site appraisal of structures valued $250,000 or more and completed it in September 2024. The company has maintained Naples’ historical values since 2009.

“The on-site inspector determined that at some of the utility related structures, the contents were actually viewed as permanently installed equipment,” McCullers said of blanket coverage, which includes buildings and contents.

The city had the option of maintaining current insurable values, but that would reduce coverage to stated-value coverage, with an 80% coinsurance clause, meaning properties must be insured for at least 80% of replacement costs to receive full coverage for a loss, or pay a penalty. Blanket coverage provides up to the sum of all assets for the insured replacement cost of any individual unit or item and pays the actual cost to rebuild — even if it’s over the amount listed on the city’s schedule of insured property.

“This has become very important in Florida when factoring in demand and high inflation costs in the aftermath of catastrophic events,” McCullers said, noting Brown & Brown recommended increasing insurable values to 17%. “Blanket coverage offers the broadest coverage and eliminates the risk of additional financial loss to the city in the event of a property loss.”

Among the 40 sites covered are City Hall, a 25,600-square-foot building at 735 Eighth St. S., with a $5.23 million replacement cost and $5.9 million insurable value. The adjacent 2,813-square-foot Council Chambers has a replacement cost of $595,500, with a $661,000 insurable value. Both were built in 1979.

Next door, Fire Station No. 1, built in 2019, has a $7.73 million replacement cost and a $7.84 million insurable value, while Naples Police Department, 355 Riverside Circle, and the adjacent public safety building total 30,858 square feet, have a $6.76 million replacement cost and a $7.94 million insurable value. They were built in 1974.

5.title: Emergency Crews Work Against Flare-Ups and Dry Conditions In Pawnee County
5.snippet: Emergency crews are battling multiple wildfires in Pawnee County, facing challenges due to dry conditions. Evacuation orders lifted; residents urged to...
5.content:
Emergency crews are battling multiple wildfires in Pawnee County, facing challenges due to dry conditions. Evacuation orders lifted; residents urged to remain cautious.

By: David Prock

-

Crews are working to contain multiple wildfires that ignited early Wednesday morning across Pawnee County, with first responders spread across the Westport and Oak Grove areas battling flare-ups and hot spots.

Current Fire Conditions

First responders from multiple agencies, including the Oklahoma Forestry Service, U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Cleveland Fire Department, and local volunteers, are actively working to extinguish remaining fires.

Officials say the biggest challenge is the lack of a clear fire line or direction, making containment efforts difficult.

Affected Areas

The fires started near Cimarron Road and Old Westport Road. Flames have spread along Old Keystone Highway and Highway 412.

Public Safety Updates

Pawnee County Emergency Management has lifted evacuation orders but is urging residents to remain cautious and stay clear of emergency crews. Officials continue to monitor conditions and warn that flare-ups remain a possibility due to dry conditions and shifting winds.

6.title: Wall Street Bulls Look Optimistic About UPS (UPS): Should You Buy?
6.snippet: Based on the average brokerage recommendation (ABR), UPS (UPS) should be added to one's portfolio. Wall Street analysts' overly optimistic recommendations...
6.content:
When deciding whether to buy, sell, or hold a stock, investors often rely on analyst recommendations. Media reports about rating changes by these brokerage-firm-employed (or sell-side) analysts often influence a stock's price, but are they really important?

Before we discuss the reliability of brokerage recommendations and how to use them to your advantage, let's see what these Wall Street heavyweights think about United Parcel Service (UPS).

UPS currently has an average brokerage recommendation (ABR) of 1.87, on a scale of 1 to 5 (Strong Buy to Strong Sell), calculated based on the actual recommendations (Buy, Hold, Sell, etc.) made by 29 brokerage firms. An ABR of 1.87 approximates between Strong Buy and Buy.

Of the 29 recommendations that derive the current ABR, 18 are Strong Buy, representing 62.1% of all recommendations.

Brokerage Recommendation Trends for UPS

Broker Rating Breakdown Chart for UPS





Check price target & stock forecast for UPS here>>>



The ABR suggests buying UPS, but making an investment decision solely on the basis of this information might not be a good idea. According to several studies, brokerage recommendations have little to no success guiding investors to choose stocks with the most potential for price appreciation.

Are you wondering why? The vested interest of brokerage firms in a stock they cover often results in a strong positive bias of their analysts in rating it. Our research shows that for every "Strong Sell" recommendation, brokerage firms assign five "Strong Buy" recommendations.

This means that the interests of these institutions are not always aligned with those of retail investors, giving little insight into the direction of a stock's future price movement. It would therefore be best to use this information to validate your own analysis or a tool that has proven to be highly effective at predicting stock price movements.

Zacks Rank, our proprietary stock rating tool with an impressive externally audited track record, categorizes stocks into five groups, ranging from Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) to Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell), and is an effective indicator of a stock's price performance in the near future. Therefore, using the ABR to validate the Zacks Rank could be an efficient way of making a profitable investment decision.

Zacks Rank Should Not Be Confused With ABR

In spite of the fact that Zacks Rank and ABR both appear on a scale from 1 to 5, they are two completely different measures.

Broker recommendations are the sole basis for calculating the ABR, which is typically displayed in decimals (such as 1.28). The Zacks Rank, on the other hand, is a quantitative model designed to harness the power of earnings estimate revisions. It is displayed in whole numbers -- 1 to 5.

7.title: EIC Chooses Nine Quantum Tech Start-ups in Latest Funding Round
7.snippet: The EIC announced the results of its most competitive funding rounds yet, selecting nine quantum technology start-ups.
7.content:
Insider Brief

The European Innovation Council (EIC) announced the results of its most competitive funding rounds yet, selecting nine quantum technology start-ups and SMEs to receive grants from the Transition and Accelerator programs.

Five start-ups were awarded funding under the EIC Transition initiative, each receiving approximately €2.5 million to advance lab-stage quantum technologies toward market readiness.

Four quantum technology SMEs secured grants under the EIC Accelerator initiative, including SemiQon (€17.5 million) and eleQtron (€12.5 million), to scale up innovations with higher technology readiness levels.

PRESS RELEASE — The European Innovation Council (EIC) recently announced the results of their Transition and Accelerator calls following the last cut-offs in October 2024, calling them their “most competitive” funding rounds so far after record numbers of submissions were received. Despite this fierce competition, nine European quantum technology start-ups/SMEs were selected to receive grants.

The EIC Transition initiative aims at “accelerating groundbreaking technologies from lab to market readiness”. From a record 413 proposals, the recent announcement revealed 40 projects were chosen to receive roughly €2.5mil each. This included 5 grants for start-ups in the field of quantum technologies, working on the following projects:

HQS-NextNMR (HQS Quantum Simulations GmbH, DE) – Next-Gen NMR Prediction and Analysis: A Cutting-Edge Tool for High-Precision Structure Identification

– Next-Gen NMR Prediction and Analysis: A Cutting-Edge Tool for High-Precision Structure Identification SQELETON (Silent Waves, FR) – Scalable Qubit Readout to Resolve Superconducting Quantum Computing’s Skeleton in the Closet

Scalable Qubit Readout to Resolve Superconducting Quantum Computing’s Skeleton in the Closet Q-SPIN (ThinkQuantum SRL, IT) – Quantum system for polarization-based internet networking

Quantum system for polarization-based internet networking InQubate (Delft Networks B.V., NL) – Integrated Quantum Network Node using Chip-based Qubit Devices

Integrated Quantum Network Node using Chip-based Qubit Devices PAQAAL (CubIQ B.V., NL) – Developing Photonic-Electronic Analog Application-Specific Integrated Circuits for a Quantum Secure Coherent Link

The EIC Accelerator initiative, meanwhile, supports SMEs to develop and scale up high-impact innovations, aiming for higher TRLs. Despite receive the highest ever number of submissions for an EIC Accelerator funding round – a staggering 1211 – amongst the 71 successful companies there are four quantum technology SMEs. The companies SemiQon (Finland) and eleQtron (Germany), for example, have revealed they will receive the considerable sums of €17.5mil and €12.5mil respectively. The winning projects are:

COOL-CHIPS (SemiQon Technologies OY, FI) – Cool-Chips – Cryogenic CMOS chips for quantum, HPC and space industry

– Cool-Chips – Cryogenic CMOS chips for quantum, HPC and space industry MCQube (Quobly, FR) – Breaking Barriers in Scalable Quantum Computing

Breaking Barriers in Scalable Quantum Computing MAGICAL (eleQtron GmbH, DE) – All-integrated on-chip ion trap towards fault-tolerant quantum computing

All-integrated on-chip ion trap towards fault-tolerant quantum computing Tuxedo (Delft Circuits B.V., NL) – Development of Tuxedo: a superconducting flex-to-pcb interface connection for quantum technologies

As we announced previously, in the first EIC cut-off of 2024 a total of 10 quantum technology projects were chosen under the EIC Pathfinder Open and EIC Accelerator calls.

8.title: Pop-Ups Prove Their Versatility: Product Debuts, Event Tie-Ins and On-the-Ground Testing
8.snippet: While pop-ups aren't a new phenomenon, they have become more sophisticated and varied in recent years.
8.content:
While pop-ups aren’t a new phenomenon, they have become more sophisticated and varied in recent years. They can be as small (and mobile) as a food truck, like Haleon’s pop-up that offered tote bags and hot beverages to denizens of NYC’s East Village during the 2024 holiday season. Or they can rotate through different themes like The Corner at the Nordstrom NYC flagship, which hosted Bode at in March 2024 as the first of its high-profile “guests.” They can even show off new, high-tech products, like the LA Meta Lab dedicated to the company’s AI-powered Ray-Ban smart glasses.

Retailers also use pop-ups as testing grounds for permanent brick-and-mortar locations, as Kizik and design firm MG2 did with the retailer’s NYC pop-up in 2024. The original pop-up proved so popular that Kizik extended its original operating dates while the brand planned two permanent shops — one in King of Prussia, Pa. and the other in the Mall of America. Pop-up stores also can “put down roots” as a permanent retail location, as Revolve Group did in January 2025 following its successful pop-up at LA’s The Grove.

Event Tie-Ins Provide Fertile Ground for Pop-Ups

Sports and cultural events also are prime locations for pop-ups, as retail marketers seek to tap into consumer excitement and foot traffic. Savvy retailers will source or create event-specific merchandise for pop-up locations, as Saks Fifth Avenue did for the 50th anniversary of Saturday Night Live in January 2025 (the show tapes in Rockefeller Center, across the street from the Saks Fifth Avenue flagship). Saks rolled out an exclusive line of SNL merchandise via a dedicated landing page on its website as well as in two pop-up shops and a special window installation.

Abercrombie & Fitch likewise tied its Super Bowl LIX pop-up, held Feb. 8, 2025 in New Orleans, to products — in this case the retailer’s National Football League-licensed apparel collection. Visitors could personalize their purchases at a custom embroidery station and participate in meet-and-greets with NFL stars, with additional invite-only VIP events throughout the day.

Advertisement

In a tie-in with the New York City Marathon, On Running used its pop-up shop not only to take advantage of runners’ presence in the city but also to demonstrate its high-tech product manufacturing. The pop-up featured a fully automated LightSpray machine that created personalized LightSpray shoe uppers in three minutes. The single-step spraying process is designed to reduce waste, generating 75% fewer carbon emissions than the brand’s other racing shoe uppers.

Pop-Ups Act as Brand Ambassadors

Some retailers use pop-ups to signal a change in their brand positioning as well as a chance to interact with consumers in new ways. In fall 2024, H&M used a series of seven pop-ups in cities across the U.S. and Canada designed to immerse visitors in a modern, engaging space featuring “the very best of the brand’s fashion identity,” according to a company statement. The pop-ups featured aroma installations where guests could create personalized bottles of essential oils, with an expert walking them through each of the six base oils and potential pairings.

Walmart used a pop-up that toured 40 cities to boost its fashion street cred with the Walmart Style Tour this past fall. Each stop on the tour included interactive experiences designed to position Walmart as a fashion expert, including a curated selection of #WalmartFinds, shoppable via QR codes; style tips from Walmart Style Tour stylists; free personalized color analysis to help guests find the best seasonal shades for their skin and hair tones; and personalized product giveaways.

Linking Physical Pop-Ups with Digital Touch Points

Anthropologie views its pop-ups as a feedback loop with its loyal customer base, reflecting and amplifying trends. For Anthropologie’s Holiday House pop-up in October 2023, the retailer partnered with trend barometer Pinterest, transforming a historic Brooklyn brownstone into six curated holiday concepts and a series of events.

Additionally, the retailer’s Anthro Fruit Stand pop-ups at The Grove in Los Angeles and in NYC’s Union Square, linked these IRL experiences with its stores and digital presence. With the use of on-site QR codes, Anthropologie boosted category-specific DTC item sales at the installations and also facilitated customer acquisition efforts via registration for the brand’s AnthroPerks loyalty program. The real-world pop-ups were amplified with a virtual Fruit Stand on the Anthropologie website.

Bigger is Better

And then there are the unconventional pop-ups, some of which don’t include traditional retailing opportunities but do garner attention and generate buzz. The Ikea Big Blue Bag, a 19-foot-high version of its iconic Frakta blue bag, visited several cities in June 2023. Viewers scanning QR codes located on the sculpture were offered exclusive discounts, with scans generating AR animation of Ikea products flying out of the bag before providing users with directions for claiming their offers.

Levi Strauss & Co. created a pair of 501 Jeans measuring 12 feet tall, nearly five times the size of a normal pair of jeans, which toured five malls in mid-2024. Members of the retailer’s Red Tab loyalty program who showed a picture of themselves with the jeans were eligible for a 40% discount off the price of a regular-sized pair of jeans.

9.title: 2025 NCAA Division III Championships: Day 1 Ups/Downs
9.snippet: For those unfamiliar with swimming terminology, the concept of “Ups” and “Downs” is a good way to track which teams performed best at prelims.
9.content:
2025 NCAA DIII Swimming and Diving Championships

March 19-22, 2025

Location: Greensboro Aquatic Center, Greensboro, NC

Times: Prelims 10:00 AM / Finals 6:00 PM (ET)

Defending Champs: Kenyon women (1x) & Emory men (3x)

Psych Sheet

Live Streaming on NCAA.com

Live Results

“NCAA DIII Championships” on Meet Mobile

Recaps Day 1 Prelims



For those unfamiliar with swimming terminology, the concept of “Ups” and “Downs” is a good way to track which teams performed best at prelims. In prelims, swimmers qualify for one of two finals heats: the top 8 finishers make the A final and places 9 through 16, the B final. In finals, swimmers are locked into their respective final, meaning a swimmer in the B heat (spots 9-16) can only place as high as 9th or as low as 16th, even if they put up the fastest or slowest time of any heat in the final.

With that in mind, we’ll be tracking “Ups” and “Downs” after each prelims session. “Up” refers to swimmers in the A final, and “Down” to swimmers in the B final.

The Kenyon women out-swam their seeds this morning to position themselves for a title defense. The schools dominating the team race discussion have been Kenyon, MIT, and NYU, but Denison vaulted themselves into contention as well this morning. The NCAC rivals are tied with 5/2 this morning.

The NYU women have six finals swims tonight, but going 1/3 in one of their best events, the 500 free, puts a ceiling on the points they can grab. They’ll need every point they can get, as they have no finalists in the 200 IM. Still, with Kaley McIntyre lowering her national record in the 50 free in prelims, the Violet should have an easy time grabbing points at the end of the session. The MIT women are in a similar boat; with no finalists in the 500 free, they will be depending on their finalists elsewhere to keep pace. Still, the Engineers have a little more room to swing as they’re only the 5th fastest qualifiers in the relay.

On the men’s side, Denison has nine finals swims on deck (4/5). With so many B finalists, they aren’t on pace to match their projected score from the psych sheets, but by sheer numbers the Big Red look well on their way for a redemption after finishing 6th last year. In addition, diver Nick Fogle qualified for the championship final on 3-meter, which will add at minimum 11 points to their total.

NYU has the second-most finals appearances tonight (3/1), though just missing out on the A final in the 400 medley might allow room for Kenyon (3/0) to slip by. Chicago had a strong individual showing (2/2), but a disqualification in the 400 medley relay prelims will sting.

0.title: Photographer Takes Breathtaking Wildlife Close-Ups That Showcase The Beauty Of The Animal Kingdom (39 Pics)
0.snippet: Sean has traveled across the UK and Europe, doing what he loves most—capturing the beauty of wildlife through his lens. More info: Instagram...
0.content:
Pelicans, elephants, seals, and many other wildlife animals may feel out of reach to some, but through photography, Sean Weekly brings them closer to us.

After moving to Singapore, Sean was captivated by its diverse wildlife, sparking his interest in photography. This led him to purchase his first DSLR camera in 2010. After countless hours of studying and practicing, his skills improved, and he developed a unique style.

Fast forward to today, Sean has traveled across the UK and Europe, doing what he loves most—capturing the beauty of wildlife through his lens.

More info: Instagram | seanweekly.com | Facebook

#1

Image credits: seanweekly

In an interview with Bored Panda, Sean shared more about himself and his achievements.

“I’m a multi-award-winner and full-time photographer. My work is regularly featured across a range of national and international publications.

After a career as a Royal Marine, I moved to the diverse habitats of Singapore where long-tailed macaques, snakes, lizards, and tropical birds were just a stone's throw away from my home.

Traveling through Southeast Asia and Australia with my camera was what ignited my love of the natural world and now I venture across the globe to expand my wildlife photography. I have led numerous workshops in the UK and further afield in Europe at locations including, Greece, Norway, Zambia, Alaska, and Japan to name a few.”

#2

Image credits: seanweekly

#3

Image credits: seanweekly

Sean often focuses a lot of his attention on Pelican, therefore we asked what he loves about photographing them.

He responded: “They are such gorgeous and majestic birds that are so prehistoric looking. Their habitat is surrounded by gorgeous snow-capped mountains making it the perfect location for any wildlife photographer.”

#4

Image credits: seanweekly

#5

Image credits: seanweekly

He also shared the most memorable moment that he had photographed these majestic birds.

“The most memorable moment was probably a few weeks ago when I was out on the lake photographing the pelicans and I was greeted by some very heavy snowfall. I have been photographing these birds for many years but never photographed them during a snowstorm.”

#6

Image credits: seanweekly

#7

Image credits: seanweekly

We were wondering how important patience is in wildlife photography, to which Sean replied: “Patience is a critical element when it comes to wildlife photography. Animals are unpredictable and can run away in the blink of an eye. In addition, the weather, lighting, and surrounding environment is constantly changing. If you want to tackle all these factors and set yourself up for success, you'll need to give yourself ample time and learn the art of patience.”

#8

Image credits: seanweekly

#9

Image credits: seanweekly

“First and foremost, wildlife photography is all about capturing the natural behavior of animals. Wild animals are unpredictable, move around frequently, and each species behaves differently. As a wildlife photographer, it is essential to wait patiently for the perfect moment to capture the ideal shot. This moment can take a few seconds, minutes, or even hours. If you're photographing a small bird, for instance, it could leave your field of view in the blink of an eye. If you're photographing a Bison, you will likely have much more time and flexibility as these animals slowly move throughout their environment. Bottom line, animals are unpredictable, and you will have to take the time to work around their behavior.”

#10

Image credits: seanweekly

#11

Image credits: seanweekly

Lastly, Sean added by answering whether he hopes for people to care more about nature after seeing his images.

“Yes, I hope my photography inspires many people of the beauty of the natural world.”

1.title: Serie A line-ups: Lecce vs. Milan
1.snippet: Milan in crisis try to avoid a fourth straight Serie A defeat in Lecce, but also drop Youssouf Fofana, Rafael Leao and Joao Felix, with Mike Maignan...
1.content:
Milan in crisis try to avoid a fourth straight Serie A defeat in Lecce, but also drop Youssouf Fofana, Rafael Leao and Joao Felix, with Mike Maignan suspended.

It kicks off at the Stadio Via del Mare at 17.00 GMT.

OneFootball Videos

Sergio Conceicao is pushing the panic button after a disastrous run of form that saw them crash out of the Champions League, then lose three Serie A matches in a row, culminating in the last-gasp 2-1 home defeat to Lazio.

Maignan and Strahinja Pavlovic picked up cards and are therefore suspended today, but Conceicao is also revolutionising his squad to shake up some big names.

Joao Felix, Rafael Leao and Youssouf Fofana are all left on the bench, while Warren Bondo makes his debut after arriving injured from Monza in January.

Alex Jimenez is pushed into a more advanced role behind Santiago Gimenez, while Kyle Walker returns to the starting XI after fitness issues.

LECCE, ITALY – FEBRUARY 09: Santiago Pierotti of Lecce competes for the ball with Charalampos Lykogiannis of Bologna during the Serie A match between Lecce and Bologna at Stadio Via del Mare on February 09, 2025 in Lecce, Italy. (Photo by Maurizio Lagana/Getty Images)

Lecce are without a win in four and haven’t scored in any of those matches either, confirming where their problems lie.

Their last two games were narrow 1-0 defeats to Udinese and Fiorentina respectively.

Santiago Pierotti is back after an ankle knock, while Nikola Krstovic and Thorir Helgason have also shaken off issues, leaving only Filip Marchwinski on the treatment table.

Coach Marco Giampaolo had an extremely brief tenure as coach of Milan in 2019, managing only seven games before he was sacked.

Former Milan winger Ante Rebic is also on the bench ready to come on.

Lecce vs. Milan line-ups

Lecce: Falcone; Guilbert, Baschirotto, Jean, Gallo; Coulibaly, Berisha, Helgason; Pierotti, Krstovic, Tete Morente

3.title: Serie A official line-ups: Bologna vs. Lazio
3.snippet: There is a big head-to-head for fifth place this afternoon, as Santiago Castro's Bologna are just one point behind Mattia Zaccagni, Nuno Tavares and Lazio.
3.content:
PLZEN, CZECH REPUBLIC - MARCH 06: Alessio Romagnoli o0f SS Lçazio celebrates a opening goal during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 Round of 16 First Leg match between FC Viktoria Plzen and S.S. Lazio at Stadion mesta Plzne on March 06, 2025 in Plzen, Czech Republic. (Photo by Marco Rosi - SS Lazio/Getty Images)

There is a big head-to-head for fifth place this afternoon, as Santiago Castro’s Bologna are just one point behind Mattia Zaccagni, Nuno Tavares and Lazio.

It kicks off at the Stadio Dall’Ara at 14.00 GMT.

You can follow all the build-up and action as it happens from today’s five Serie A matches on the Liveblog.

This could be a decisive crossroads in the campaign for European placement, as Bologna have climbed back up the standings in recent weeks and are just one point behind Lazio.

Their treatment table has emptied out and even Remo Freuler returns from suspension to bolster the midfield.

Castro gets the nod ahead of Thijjs Dallinga upfront, with support from Riccardo Orsolini, Dan Ndoye and Jens Odgaard.

Lazio were in action on Thursday for the Europa League, drawing 1-1 with Viktoria Plzen to go through 3-2 on aggregate and set up a quarter-final against Bodo/Glimt.

Taty Castellanos is back in the squad after a long injury lay-off, but only ready for the bench, so Boulaye Dia leads the attack with support from Matias Vecino, Gustav Isaksen and Zaccagni.

Mario Gila and Niccolò Rovella return to the starting XI, but Adam Marusic is not at 100 per cent.

Bologna vs. Lazio line-ups

Bologna: Skorupski; Calabria, Beukema, Lucumi, Miranda; Freuler, Ferguson; Orsolini, Odgaard, Ndoye; Castro

Lazio: Provedel; Lazzari, Gila, Romagnoli, Nuno Tavares; Guendouzi, Rovella; Isaksen, Vecino, Zaccagni; Dia

4.content:
We can confirm the starting line-ups and substitutes for today’s Premier League trip to Fulham (1.30pm UK).

Ange Postecoglou has made seven changes to the team that started against AZ Alkmaar on Thursday.

Ben Davies and Destiny Udogie come into the back four in place of Micky van de Ven and Pedro Porro, while there’s a whole new midfield with Rodrigo Bentancur, Archie Gray and Yves Bissouma in for Pape Matar Sarr, Lucas Bergvall and James Maddison.

In the wide attacking positions, Brennan Johnson and Mathys Tel come in for Wilson Odobert and Heung-Min Son.

Cristian Romero captains the team today.

Our full team is as follows...

5.title: Liverpool vs Newcastle LIVE: Carabao Cup final team news and line-ups as Slot makes call on Alisson and Kelleher
5.snippet: Liverpool are the holders at Wembley while Newcastle have not won a major trophy in 70 years.
5.content:
✕ Close Looking forward to final, really want to win it - Slot

Liverpool and Newcastle United clash at Wembley with the first silverware of the season up for grabs in the Carabao Cup final.

Newcastle have not won a major domestic trophy in 70 years and the Magpies will travel down to London with high hopes of ending one of the longest droughts in British sport. Eddie Howe’s side lost the 2023 final to Manchester United and have endured a woeful record against Liverpool in recent years, with the Reds winning seven of their eight meetings since Howe took charge.

Liverpool are the Premier League champions elect but will be looking to win a first trophy under Arne Slot, having gone out of the Champions League to Paris Saint-Germain in midweek. They are the record winners of the League Cup and lifted a 10th title by beating Chelsea under Jurgen Klopp last season. Klopp’s final trophy at Liverpool could be followed by Slot’s first.

The final also puts two of the season’s outstanding forwards head to head as Mohamed Salah faces Alexander Isak. Salah could well be entering the final weeks of his Liverpool career, with his contract running out in the summer, while Newcastle will by relying on the in-demand Isak more than ever after losing Anthony Gordon to suspension.

Follow all the build-up and team news ahead of Liverpool vs Newcastle in the Carabao Cup final, below:

6.title: PREDICTED LINE-UPS | Fiorentina v Juventus
6.snippet: Reeling on the back of a crushing 4-0 defeat against Atalanta, Juventus will aim to return to winning ways when they face Fiorentina at the Stadio Artemio...
6.content:
Reeling on the back of a crushing 4-0 defeat against Atalanta, Juventus will aim to return to winning ways when they face Fiorentina at the Stadio Artemio Franchi.

After bowing out of the Champions League by losing to PSV Eindhoven on aggregate, Juventus hoped to keep their faint Serie A title race alive. However, they were beaten at Turin for the first time since 1967 by four goals as strikes from Mateo Retegui, Marten de Roon, Davide Zappacosta and Ademola Lookman drowned the Bianconeri.

OneFootball Videos

The pressure is on Thiago Motta now as Juventus are on the brink of losing out on a top-four spot with Lazio and Bologna closing in. Juventus have lost just one of their last eight fixtures against Fiorentina and they will bank on that record to overcome their opposition tonight.

Meanwhile, Fiorentina’s last match left them in jubilant mood as they overcame a deficit on aggregate versus Panathinaikos to reach the Conference League quarter-finals. Rolando Mandragora, Albert Gudmundsson and Moise Kean led the spirited comeback as the Viola remain in firm contention for European glory this season.

Despite their European exploits, Rafaelle Palladino’s men have failed to impress in the league this season but they can still manage a Conference League or Europa League spot if they register couple of favourable results in the next few games.

Here are the predicted line-ups for the match according to Sky Italia:

Fiorentina (3-5-2): De Gea; Comuzzo, Marì, Ranieri; Dodò, Cataldi, Mandragora, Fagioli, Gosens; Gudmundsson, Kean.

Juventus (4-2-3-1): Di Gregorio; Kalulu, Kelly, Veiga, Weah; Locatelli, Thuram; Koopmeiners, McKennie, Nico Gonzalez; Kolo Muani.

Trambak Bhattacherjee | GIFN

Share this article

7.title: Liverpool vs Newcastle: Starting line-ups for Carabao Cup Final as key men miss out
7.snippet: Newcastle United look to win their first major trophy since 1955 on Sunday afternoon, but must get past serial winners and runaway Premier League leaders...
7.content:
Arne Slot looks for his first trophy as Liverpool manager but must do so without Trent Alexander-Arnold.

Or his replacement. Or his third choice at right back.

The Kop boss is without the England international after he hobbled off against PSG in midweek. The club hope he will be able to play against before the Premier League champions-elect end their campaign - otherwise, he may well have played his final game for the Reds, with a summer switch to Real Madrid seeming increasingly likely.

At Wembley, with he, Conor Bradley and Joe Gomez all absent, Slot has a choice to make. Curtis Jones has been mooted in some quarters as an option, but Jarrell Quansah looks set to get the nod, with slot having talked up his attributes on Friday.

Jones may well get a starting spot further forwards however. After their Champions League disappointment on Tuesday, Diogo Jota could be yanked from the starting lineup and the England international installed into midfield to bolster numbers in there against a strong Newcastle trio.

That would see Luis Diaz start down the middle, with Mo Salah in his customary right-sided spot, and Dominik Szoboszlai asked to play more from the left, in a more advanced role.

Image: Iain Buist/Newcastle Chronicle) Iain Buist/Newcastle Chronicle)

Magpies skipper Bruno Guimaraes admits he'll have no qualms about crying if he can fulfil the promise he made to Toon fans on the day he signed, and lift the trophy.

And he says: "Even in my wildest dreams, I couldn't think about it, in my first season as captain to lift a trophy for this club for the first time in a long, long time. Wow. It would be massive."

He scored the winner at West Ham on Monday night and Eddie Howe could pick an unchanged starting lineup, with Anthony Gordon still suspended and both Sven Botman and Lewis Hall sidelined due to injury.

Guimaraes will continue in a midfield three alongside Joelinton and Sandro Tonali, with the only real question mark over Harvey Barnes. Standing in for Gordon recently, he could miss out if Joe Willock is preferred instead. That will be a late decision made by Howe.

Liverpool Starting Lineup: Alisson; Quansah, Konate, Van Djik, Robertson; Gravenberch, Mac Allister; Jones, Szoboszlai; Salah, Diaz.

Newcastle Starting Lineup: Pope; Trippier, Schar, Burn, Livramento; Tonali, Guimaraes, Joelinton; Murphy, Isak, Barnes.

8.title: Serie A: Fiorentina vs. Juventus – Probable line-ups and where to watch
8.snippet: Thiago Motta looks set to shuffle a few things around for Juventus's upcoming Serie A match away against Fiorentina on Sunday evening, in a weekend that...
8.content:
epa11797881 Juventus' Khephren Thuram (3-L) celebrates after scoring the 2-1 goal in the Italian Serie A soccer match Juventus FC vs ACF Fiorentina at the Allianz Stadium in Turin, Italy, 29 December 2024. EPA-EFE/ALESSANDRO DI MARCO

Thiago Motta looks set to shuffle a few things around for Juventus’s upcoming Serie A match away against Fiorentina on Sunday evening, in a weekend that could bring plenty of changes to the Champions League race.

Both sides are vying for a spot in European competition next season. Juventus are in fourth at the beginning of Sunday, but could be overtaken before kick-off by either Lazio or Bologna depending on the result in the game between those two sides on Sunday afternoon.

Fiorentina are currently in ninth, which means they need to make up at least two positions in the table to claim a spot in a UEFA competition for next season.

Raffaele Palladino looks set to stick with his currently preferred 3-5-2 system led by top goalscorer Moise Kean and Albert Gudmundsson in attack.

The Juventus front line will be led by Randal Kolo Muani again, who is expected to be supported by an attacking cast of Teun Koopmeiners, Weston McKennie and Douglas Luiz. Koopmeiners is reportedly set to start out wide on the right with McKennie in a more central position.

There could also be a return to the Bianconeri side for January recruit Renato Veiga, who could play alongside Lloyd Kelly, Pierre Kalulu and Timothy Weah.

Kick-off is due at 17.00 GMT.

Fiorentina vs. Juventus: Probable line-ups

Fiorentina (3-5-2): De Gea; Comuzzo, Marì, Ranieri; Dodò, Cataldi, Mandragora, Fagioli, Gosens; Gudmundsson, Kean.

Juventus (4-2-3-1): Di Gregorio; Kalulu, Kelly, Veiga, Weah; Locatelli, Thuram; Koopmeiners, McKennie, Nico Gonzalez; Kolo Muani.

Where to watch Fiorentina vs. Juventus

Today’s game will be available to watch live in the UK through OneFootball. Supporters in the USA will be able to tune in via Paramount+. The game will be shown on DAZN in Italy.

Join us for the pre-match build-up, in-game coverage and post-match reactions as they come in on the Football Italia Liveblog.

9.title: Arsenal v Chelsea LIVE: Team news and line-ups with Cole Palmer ruled out for Blues
9.snippet: Arsenal can close the huge gap to Liverpool at the top of the table but Chelsea come to the Emirates in form and chasing their own Champions League...
9.content:
✕ Close Dewsbury-Hall can be important for Chelsea, claims Maresca

Arsenal are hosting Chelsea at the Emirates Stadium today in what is sure to be a feisty London derby between two Premier League rivals.

The second-placed Gunners can reduce the 15-point gap to Liverpool with a victory here, on a day when the league leaders play Newcastle in the Carabao Cup final, and Mikel Arteta has the benefit of bringing back several of the stars he rested for the midweek draw with PSV in the Champions League, as Arsenal chase their first league win for a month.

Chelsea arrive with confidence, however, on a run of four successive wins in all competitions after knocking out FC Copenhagen in the Europa Conference League in midweek, and Enzo Maresca’s side will believe they can cause a shock at the home of their old enemy.

Follow all the latest updates from Arsenal v Chelsea below.

0.title: DII NCAA Championships: Women’s Team Race Only Getting Closer; Day 5 Ups/Downs
0.snippet: For those unfamiliar with swimming terminology, the concept of “Ups” and “Downs” is a good way to track which teams performed best during prelims.
0.content:
2025 NCAA Division II Swimming & Diving Championship

For those unfamiliar with swimming terminology, the concept of “Ups” and “Downs” is a good way to track which teams performed best during prelims. In prelims at the SEC Championships, swimmers qualify for one of three finals: the top eight finishers make the ‘A’ final (Ups), places nine through 16 make the ‘B’ final (Mids), and places 17 through 24 made the ‘C’ final (Downs). In finals, swimmers are locked into their respective final, meaning a swimmer in the ‘B’ final can only place as high as 9th or as low as 16th, even if they swim the fastest or slowest time of the event in any final.

With that in mind, we track “Ups”, “Mids”, and “Downs” after each prelims session.

Women’s Meet

Updated Scores

Note: We are only including teams in the table who have at least one finalist. They are sorted in order of team score.

This team race has been one of the most exciting things we are watching this week, and it will all come down to tonight. Based on prelims performance and relay seeds, Drury and Nova S’eastern would be exactly tied at the end of the evening. This is not including the mile, where Nova has a swimmer in the final and Drury does not.

Yesterday, Drury far outperformed their morning, and while they have little room for improvement in the 200 breaststroke, their 200 backstroker could move up her placement quite a bit, narrowing that gap for no mile swimmers.

Nova has a lot of space to move up, putting seven swimmers into finals in all three events.

Ultimately, it is very likely it will all come down to the relay and who performs the best there.

1.title: Ups and downs define early season for Robeson baseball teams
1.snippet: Through the first three weeks of the high school baseball season, every local program has experienced both highs and lows.
1.content:
Purnell Swett’s Chandon Sanderson throws the ball towards first base during an April 26, 2024 game at Lumberton.

Through the first three weeks of the high school baseball season, every local program has experienced both highs and lows.

Entering Friday’s play, each team had at least two wins, with three totaling four or more, and each team also had at least two losses.

With the bulk of the season still to come, each will look to build on the triumphs and learn from the defeats.

Listed alphabetically, here is a look at how each team has performed so far and an outlook for the rest of the season.

Fairmont Golden Tornadoes

After splitting its first four decisions, Fairmont (5-2) entered Friday on a three-game winning streak, including 16- and 12-run outputs in two of those wins.

“We have times where we’ve swung the bat really well and the things we’re teaching in practice, we can see it showing up, and then there’s been times where it seems like we’ve gone in the batters box and we’re just out there playing a pickup game,” Fairmont coach Kelly Chavis said. “I think we’re more on the side of figuring a lot of that out.”

Chavis also likes his pitching and defense so far, with the team allowing 3.0 runs per game, with 2024 Robeson County Pitcher of the Year Parker Chavis leading the staff.

“Up to this point I feel like our pitching has been solid and our defense has been pretty good,” Chavis said. “Our pitching’s given us a chance to win ballgames.”

Among his seven seniors — Kenley Callahan, Nemo Chavis, Trent Collins, R.J. Deese, Jamien Scott, Mynkoda Smith and Kyland Strickland — Kelly Chavis says any of them can be a team leader on any given day. Nemo Chavis and Kenley Callahan have been key at the top of the lineup, the coach said, and R.J. Deese and Jamarion Brown have also “swung the bat pretty good” thus far, and Jayden Hunt is a strong baserunner and defensive player.

While having broader goals like winning the Robeson County Slugfest or a conference championship, Kelly Chavis also says if his team meets the smallest goals then the others will take care of themselves.

“Our goal is to win every pitch,” Kelly Chavis said. “If we win every pitch, then we feel like we’re going to win every inning, win every game, and so on from there.”

Lumberton Pirates

Lumberton coach Jeff McLamb says he had a “heart-to-heart” with his team after losing its first two games — and the Pirates (4-2, 3-0 United-8 Conference) scored 35 runs in the four games since ahead of Friday’s matchup with Gray’s Creek.

“The kids are sort of buying in to what we’re teaching at the plate, on the mound, making plays and having good pitching and getting some timely hitting,” McLamb said. “The kids, they’re buying into what we’re teaching, back-side approach, letting the ball get deep and the whole nine yards.”

At the plate, junior Brennan Griffin, sophomore Brody Stueck, senior Shaun Henderson and senior Isaac Simmons have been “tearing it up,” McLamb said, while seniors Austin Thorndyke and Nolan Groner, sophomore Manny Alba and freshman Jayden Graham are also impact players.

Senior Landon Claar leads the pitching staff, while senior Noah Britt and sophomore Caiden Hall are also off to good starts.

“Our starting pitching’s been solid. The first couple of games the guys coming out of the bullpen struggled a little bit, but after that they’ve come in and thrown strikes and done a good job.”

After some strong starts in recent seasons that have faded in the second turn through conference play, McLamb hopes this team keeps up the momentum all the way through the campaign.

“I told them, we’ve just got to keep working and take it one game at a time,” McLamb said. “As long as we play good baseball I feel like we can compete with anybody.”

Purnell Swett Rams

Purnell Swett entered Friday’s play at 4-4 overall and 2-2 in the United-8, but having won three of its last four games.

First-year coach Edmund Locklear says his team has adjusted well to his coaching style to start the season.

“I would say they’ve come from more of a laid back atmosphere the last couple of years, where I would say I’m a more old-school coach, I’m pretty tough on them, and I think they’ve responded well,” Locklear said. “They’re working hard, they’re giving me all they’ve got, and that’s all I can ask for as a coach.”

Seniors Chandon Sanderson and Camden Hunt have provided the on-field leadership, Locklear said.

“They’re always upbeat, being leaders with the team,” Locklear said. “I couldn’t ask anything better out of them.”

A large sophomore class for the Rams features Mason Brewer, Conley Jacobs, Joseden Oxendine and Grayson Brooks, each of whom are making an impact offensively.

On the mound, Sanderson threw a one-hitter against Scotland, while Oxendine has surprised Locklear with his effectiveness.

Despite two early losses in conference play, Locklear says the Rams are still among the teams with a shot at the United-8 title, with several potential contenders in a strong league.

“I think the conference is going to be wide open,” Locklear said. “I’m thinking three losses, four losses could put you in first place in the conference, because it looks like we might beat up on one another.”

Red Springs Red Devils

Despite a 3-3 record before Friday’s doubleheader with Lakewood, Red Springs coach Matt Strickland feels his team has started off “slow,” but says that the team is capable of playing better and simply experiencing some growing pains.

“(We’ve) got a couple of wins under our belt, but we’re still a very young team,” Strickland said. “It’s not talent that we lack, I think we lack experience.”

Sophomore Xzavier Sinclair has been strong both at the plate and on the mound for the Red Devils. Sophomore Terry Locklear and junior T.J. Ellerbe are among the returners that Strickland expects to make a big impact this season.

Freshmen Alfredo Lowery and Jacoby Lowery have also both been strong at the plate to start off the season.

“It’s just a team effort right now, we’re still trying to find our identity as a team,” Strickland said.

Strickland says he’s looking for the Red Devils to be more competitive in conference play, and to do well enough in the league to earn a state-playoff bid.

“In past years we’ve made strides and we’ve made some good leaps forward, but this year I feel like with the talent that I have, we can make even a bigger stride, we should be able to do more than we’ve done in the last couple years,” Strickland said. “Even though we’re still young, I feel like we’re talented enough to make a bigger impact this year than what we’ve had since I’ve been the head coach.”

St. Pauls Bulldogs

St. Pauls coach Bladen Strickland says his team hasn’t been consistent through a 2-3 start entering play Friday, but he’s proud of how they’ve competed thus far.

“We’re more of a family this year and if we get out of our own way we’re going to be a tough team to play,” Strickland said.

Strickland says his pitching staff, which has had five players make two or more appearances led by senior Jaden Parker, has been strong.

“They’re night and day from what they were last year, so I’m glad the developmental side for that,” Strickland said.

At the plate, Strickland says his team has seen a lot of pitches and just needs to finish at-bats. Senior Josh Garner is the “heart and soul” of the team and Jaylen Jacobs has also been strong thus far and is “becoming a great leader”; Theophilus Setzer made his season debut earlier this week, and Strickland said it was a “different ball team” with the Army football signee on the field.

Juniors Cameron McNeill, Cailen McNeill and Tyler Lavoie and freshman Zayin Hunt are also key contributors for the Bulldogs.

Strickland says he’s eager to win the Southeastern Athletic Conference in the current league’s final season before realignment, and that he wants the Bulldogs to make a playoff run.

“Whether it’s two (rounds), three, four, all the way to the state championship game, I want to make a run and put St. Pauls back on the map,” Strickland said. “Personal goals for me is to enjoy it, enjoy the ride, don’t stress about it too much.”

Sports editor Chris Stiles can be reached at 910-816-1977 or by email at cstiles@robesonian.com. You can follow him on X at @StilesOnSports.

2.title: Phibro Animal Health Insider Ups Holding By 20% During Year
2.snippet: Insiders were net buyers of Phibro Animal Health Corporation's ( NASDAQ:PAHC ) stock during the past year. That is...
2.content:
Insiders were net buyers of Phibro Animal Health Corporation's (NASDAQ:PAHC ) stock during the past year. That is, insiders bought more stock than they sold.

Although we don't think shareholders should simply follow insider transactions, we would consider it foolish to ignore insider transactions altogether.

Check out our latest analysis for Phibro Animal Health

Phibro Animal Health Insider Transactions Over The Last Year

In the last twelve months, the biggest single purchase by an insider was when Independent Non-Executive Director E. Corcoran bought US$111k worth of shares at a price of US$22.10 per share. That means that an insider was happy to buy shares at above the current price of US$21.25. Their view may have changed since then, but at least it shows they felt optimistic at the time. In our view, the price an insider pays for shares is very important. It is encouraging to see an insider paid above the current price for shares, as it suggests they saw value, even at higher levels. E. Corcoran was the only individual insider to buy during the last year.

E. Corcoran bought a total of 10.00k shares over the year at an average price of US$21.06. You can see the insider transactions (by companies and individuals) over the last year depicted in the chart below. If you click on the chart, you can see all the individual transactions, including the share price, individual, and the date!

NasdaqGM:PAHC Insider Trading Volume March 15th 2025

There are always plenty of stocks that insiders are buying. If investing in lesser known companies is your style, you could take a look at this free list of companies. (Hint: insiders have been buying them).

Does Phibro Animal Health Boast High Insider Ownership?

Another way to test the alignment between the leaders of a company and other shareholders is to look at how many shares they own. We usually like to see fairly high levels of insider ownership. Phibro Animal Health insiders own about US$416m worth of shares (which is 50% of the company). This kind of significant ownership by insiders does generally increase the chance that the company is run in the interest of all shareholders.

So What Does This Data Suggest About Phibro Animal Health Insiders?

It is good to see the recent insider purchase. And an analysis of the transactions over the last year also gives us confidence. When combined with notable insider ownership, these factors suggest Phibro Animal Health insiders are well aligned, and quite possibly think the share price is too low. One for the watchlist, at least! In addition to knowing about insider transactions going on, it's beneficial to identify the risks facing Phibro Animal Health. To that end, you should learn about the 3 warning signs we've spotted with Phibro Animal Health (including 2 which can't be ignored).

4.title: Can Doing Sit-Ups Give You A ‘Coregasm?’
4.snippet: There's a social media influencer who said she got a "Coregasm" from doing sit-ups. Is that really a thing?
4.content:
Can Doing Sit-Ups Give You A ‘Coregasm?’

Note: this guy is just doing some crunches and is likely not trying to Coregasm. Can Doing Sit-Ups Give You A 'Coregasm?' (Photo by Michael Dodge/Getty Images)

There’s a social media influencer who said she got a “Coregasm” from doing sit-ups. Is that really a thing?

Have you ever heard of a “Coregasm” before? This is the first I’ve heard about it, although I’m sure there are many workout and exercise trends that I’m not aware of. British influencer Sophia Habboo is going viral for saying on her podcast that she once did an ab workout that was so intense she climaxed! You can do that? She described it as different than your ordinary orgasm but it was definitely something. Now, experts are confirming that it really is a thing. Yes, if you do a hard enough ab workout you can Coregasm. You can see a TikTok video about it below. WARNING: there is an F-bomb.

What Is A “Coregasm?”

There’s even a book on the Coregasm called “The Coregasm Workout” and it’s not just a thing that happens to women. It can happen to men too! I have a feeling this could be the great motivator to inspire many people to get up and go workout. I was going to say go to the gym but maybe that isn’t the best idea if you plan on working out your abs until you Coregasm. Probably best that happens at home.

Cort Freeman was born and raised in Metro Detroit. He was named Clarkston High School 2009 Class Clown 13 years after graduating. Totally normal thing to happen. That’s thanks to his time spent as an Intern at Comedy Central and Social Media Correspondent for The Colbert Report. Cort has done comedy across the country, both standing up and sitting down. When he’s not trying to make you laugh on-air and online, he’s probably at home enjoying his favorite shows like Seinfeld, South Park, and The Office. He’s also totally uncomfortable writing about himself in the third person. Cort enjoys writing about comedy, food, sports, and entertainment. So, basically anything and everything.

5.title: UTEP men's basketball heats up, knocks off Sam Houston State to extend season
5.snippet: UTEP Miners earn Conference USA quarterfinal game against top-seeded Liberty after they finally find their range.
5.content:
UTEP men's basketball heats up, knocks off Sam Houston State to extend season

HUNTSVILLE, Alabama — Through a losing streak that reached seven games, the UTEP men's basketball team firmly felt that if it could buy a shot and heat a little from the outside, it would bleed over everywhere.

What was needed was a chance to test that theory. In a 79-65 victory over Sam Houston in the first round of the Conference USA tournament, which earned the Miners a quarterfinal with top-seeded Liberty Wednesday at 4:30 p.m. MT (5:30 p.m. CT), that theory held.

A Miners team that spent the last month searching for the basket found it in Huntsville, Ala. They made 12-of-25 3-pointers, the most they've had since conference play began in the calendar year, and that fed over to their defense.

A Sam Houston team that came in making a league-leading 40% of its 3-pointers — that's fifth nationally — made 2-of-19 3-pointers and added 13 turnovers. UTEP looked like the team that was so hot through the first part of January.

Quoting UTEP coach Joe Golding

"The 3-point line was the difference in the game," UTEP coach Joe Golding said. "They got wide-open looks against us a week ago (an 89-87 Bearkat win in Texas' Huntsville). Tuesday "we made it very difficult for them on the 3-point line. We were locked in defensively. We ran towards the ball, we swiped it hard, we were talking, we were communicating. It was pleasant for me to see us on the defensive end."

The offense was fun, too.

"No question it makes a huge difference," Golding said of the 12 3s. UTEP averaged 7 3s per game this year. "We've made some shots in this losing streak but we haven't defended. We defended (Tuesday) and we took good shots. We valued the basketball and we had great possessions.

"When you (take bad shots) you get screwed in transition. In our losing streak, we've been giving up 70 points per game, that's not us. Tonight, against a really good offensive basketball team, we hold them to 65 points.

"I thought our offense was a big reason for that. We made the extra pass, we touched paint, we got deeper in possessions. But yes, to get to 12 3-pointers is a relief."

Quoting Sam Houston State coach Chris Mudge

When asked if his team just got unlucky to run into someone uncommonly hot, Sam Houston coach Chris Mudge pointed out there was more to it than that.

"We seem to be the unluckiest team in America in anything that happens, that's just part of the game," he said. "But in the first half we let them get comfortable with giving them some open looks and they have great players.

"When great players make a couple and get confident, then they are able to make some. That's on us and on me because we let them get going and feel good. (A prolific 3-point shooting team) is not who they are, but they stepped up."

How it happened

After digging an early 13-3 hole when it made one of its first eight shots, UTEP charged in front with a 29-11 run and held Sam Houston off the rest of the way.

The Bearkats did close within 50-46 with 12:18 left. They had the momentum and were about to force a shot clock violation when Otis Frazier III danced behind the 3-point line and hit a fadeaway rainbow shot that reestablished order.

"It felt great because I was going to drive," said Frazier, one of five players in double figures with 12 points. "I backed up. I looked up and didn't have time to drive, so I let it go. I had confidence in it and it went in."

Said Golding: "We could breathe."

UTEP stars of the game

UTEP did this, as it will do everything going forward, without sixth-man Ahamad Bynum, who has been dismissed from the team for an undisclosed violation of team rules.

Center Kevin Kalu continued a splendid run of play with 15 points and 15 rebounds, while Corey Camper had his best game since spraining his ankle in February. He had a team-high 18 points and made 4-of-6 3-pointers. His previous UTEP high for 3-pointers was three.

"Every player on this team never put their head down, every player believed we were going to go on a run," Camper said. "Make sure your brother never drops his head, especially through tough times."

Frazier had a similar theme.

"Sticking together," he said. "We stuck together all year, especially on the seven-game streak. We have joy in practice, it shows in how we played."

Because of that, UTEP gets at least one more game in Huntsville, Ala.

UTEP women end season with competitive loss to Kennesaw State

The UTEP women's basketball team is about 75% of the way to being a solid outfit. The other 25% takes its form in one bad quarter, and that was again the story in a 71-63 loss to Kennesaw State in the first round of the CUSA tournament that ended UTEP's season.

In this game, the decisive quarter was the third, as UTEP's 36-34 halftime lead was erased under a sea of turnovers and Kennesaw State free throws. Specifically, the Owls outscored the Miners 20-11 in a period where UTEP had six turnovers, and the Owls made 11-of-16 free throws to the Miners' 3-of-4.

That added up to an eight-point hole to climb out of in the fourth quarter, and while UTEP did get within 62-58 with 4:12 remaining, they couldn't get enough layups to fall late to keep their season alive.

Guard Portia Adams went out with a bang, as the junior guard finished with a season-high 24 points in her best game as a Miner. Forward Dunja Zecevic added 10 in a game where UTEP was whistled for 23 fouls and had three players (Luisa Vydrova, Irene Asensio and Ndack Mbengue) foul out.

The Miners turned the ball over 17 times. Kennesaw was 20-of-33 from the free-throw line for the game while UTEP was 7-of-9.

UTEP finishes Keitha Adams' second season as head coach with an 11-19 overall record after a 4-14, 10th-place finish in CUSA.

Bret Bloomquist can be reached at bbloomquist@elpasotimes.com; @Bretbloomquist on X.

6.title: Hogarth ups Nick Lee to UK MD
6.snippet: WPP-owned Hogarth Worldwide has promoted Nick Lee to UK Managing Director. He takes over from Monica Taylor, who has been promoted to Global Chief Client...
6.content:
WPP-owned Hogarth Worldwide has promoted Nick Lee to UK Managing Director.

He takes over from Monica Taylor, who has been promoted to Global Chief Client Officer.

Lee most recently served as Global Client Managing Director at Hogarth, working with high-profile luxury brands.

His career began at AMV BBDO, where he worked with clients such as Sainsbury’s, Heinz, and BlackBerry. In 2013, he joined Havas London, playing a key role in the agency’s transformation, earning IPA and APG awards, and contributing to its B-Corp certification. During his tenure at Havas, he managed major accounts including Peugeot, Citroën, Ella’s Kitchen, and others, culminating in his appointment as the agency’s youngest Managing Partner in 2018.

His joined Hogarth in 2022, where he oversaw key luxury accounts, including Rolex and Dyson.

Nick Lee said: “From the minute I walked in the door, I knew Hogarth was different. Tons of talent but zero ego, and now, AI-powered tools like WPP Open are taking us to a whole new level. The fact we’re applying that to many of the biggest brands in the world makes it even more exciting. It’s a genuine honour to be leading the UK business at such a pivotal time.”

Matt Kitcherside, CEO, EMEA, Hogarth, said: “Having worked closely with Nick over the past couple of years, I’m delighted that he is now stepping up to the role of Managing Director for Hogarth UK. Nick has brought an infectious energy to the teams he has led in Hogarth, and I’m hugely excited about where he will take the UK business next.”

Lee has also served as an advisor to London Mayor Sadiq Khan on the Mayor’s Advisory Group for child health, mentors leadership students at Durham University, co-founded a London theatre company, and sings in an internationally awarded chamber choir.

8.title: Formula 1 Driver Line-Ups 2025: Who Are the Starting Drivers for the F1 Teams This Year?
8.snippet: The Formula 1 2025 season will be an adrenaline-fueled circus, performed on the tarmac of various tracks across the world. This high-performance convoy is...
8.content:
The teams have selected their contenders for 2025.

The Formula 1 2025 season will be an adrenaline-fueled circus, performed on the tarmac of various tracks across the world. This high-performance convoy is set to spend their last year with the 2022 Regulations. The teams have already started bracing themselves for the 2026 Formula 1 Regulations (and new contenders on the field).

The 2024 Formula 1 season witnessed another masterclass of the four-time champion Max Verstappen. He became the second Red Bull driver to achieve four championships in succession (Sebastian Vettel flashbacks anyone?). Now that Formula 1 is one the verge of starting another season, there are many questions about the driver line-ups of the 2025 season.

The first confirmed Rookie of the 2025 Formula 1 season was Aston Martin driver, Fernando Alonso (obviously a joke). The teams have already released their final list for the confirmed drivers for the 2025 season.

Driver Lineups 2025

We shall be going through the driver lineups of the teams in the finishing order of the 2024 Formula 1 Constructors championship.

McLaren

Lando Norris (#3) and Oscar Piastri (#8) are going to be drivers for the 2024 Manufacturer champions, McLaren. The duo is one of the youngest on the grid and managed to snatch multiple victories in the 2024 season. Their efforts won McLaren their first Constructors championship since 2007.

Ferrari

Charles Leclerc (#16) and Lewis Hamilton (#44) will be the star performers of the 2025 season for the Prancing Horse. This pairing is arguably the most discussed partnership on the current grid. Hamilton is the seven-time champion and one of the legends of the grid, looking forward to redemption after his disappointing stint with Mercedes in the past three seasons. Leclerc on the other hand is ecstatic to capitalize on his victories from the previous season.

Only two days to go… 👀@ScuderiaFerrari head into the season with an all-star driver pairing 🤩#F1 #AusGP pic.twitter.com/D2fR3YQNPy — Formula 1 (@F1) March 14, 2025

Red Bull Racing

Max Verstappen (#1) and Liam Lawson (#30) will form Red Bull’s starting lineup. Red Bull are the second team on the 2025 grid with major changes to their team. They let go of Adrian Newey, the air-bender, and Sergio “Checo” Perez, their Mexican Minister of Defense. Verstappen is their reigning champion and Lawson has been their junior ace as a replacement in the past two seasons.

It’s almost #AusGP weekend! 😊



Reigning drivers’ champions @redbullracing will be keen to haul themselves back into the top two in the constructors’ championship 💨#F1 pic.twitter.com/prFDWDh3dk — Formula 1 (@F1) March 13, 2025

Mercedes

George Russell (#63) and Kimi Antonelli (#12) shall start the season for the Silver Arrows. George Russell is going to take the lead after his compatriot Lewis Hamilton left the team. Toto Wolff’s young gamble, Kimi Antonelli, will have a lot to prove in the improved car of the Silver Arrows. The duo will have to build on the momentum gained by Mercedes in the past year.

Aston Martin

Fernando Alonso (#14) and Lance Stroll (#18) will be Aston Martin’s drivers for the 2025 season. With Newey joining their team, the duo is sure to benefit from his past expertise of creating championship winning Formula 1 cars. Alonso will be hunting for his next win during the 2025 season. Stroll meanwhile, would be on the lookout for his best season so far.

Retaining their line-up into 2025 are @AstonMartinF1 🤝



Can the team climb up the order in their last season with Mercedes power? 📈#F1 #AusGP pic.twitter.com/9USd9j2YL9 — Formula 1 (@F1) March 11, 2025

Alpine

Pierre Gasly (#10) and Jack Doohan (#7) are going to be the drivers for Alpine for the 2025 season. Alpine was one of the most improved teams of the 2024 season. They would be looking forward to pairing the expertise of Pierre Gasly with the newfound talent, Jack Doohan. The French team found themselves in a precarious situation with their drivers last year. They would not want the problems to repeat in 2025.

Just six more days to wait… 😍



Full GAS for @PierreGASLY, and a home debut for @jackdoohan33! #F1 pic.twitter.com/MXM7e8MTue — Formula 1 (@F1) March 10, 2025

Haas

Oliver Bearman (#87) and Esteban Ocon (#31) will be a part of the 2025 campaign for Haas Ferrari. Haas have gone through many radical changes since the 2024 season. After replacing their team principal in 2024, Haas have decided to revamp their driver lineup for the 2025 season. Bearman will be the driver to be on lookout for. It would be interesting to see his performance in a back-marker car after his exploits at Ferrari in the last season.

RB

Isack Hajdar (#6) and Yuki Tsunoda (#22) shall be the flag bearers for the 2025 season of RB. The Red Bull sister team, does not share a speck of performance with their championship winning counterpart. Tsunoda and Hajdar will have to put their best foot (or shall I say lap times) forward in order to lead the team to better results in 2025.

Racing towards round one! 😍



Fifth season for Yuki, first for Isack 👊#F1 @visacashapprb pic.twitter.com/owgL3OSG5e — Formula 1 (@F1) March 8, 2025

Williams

Alex Albon (#23) and Carlos Sainz (#55) are paired together for the 2025 season, racing for Williams. Sainz made headlines when he joined Williams for 2025. The Spaniard is a man on mission, but will he take back Williams to their former glory in Formula 1? Alex Albon has had some brilliant performances in the past season but he needs to pick up the pace if he wants to compete against a top driver from Ferrari.

9 days to go until the first Grand Prix of 2025 💪



How excited are you for the first race? 🤩#F1 pic.twitter.com/zcnDpTscnc — Formula 1 (@F1) March 7, 2025

Kick Sauber

Nico Hulkenberg (#27) and Gabriel Bortoleto (#5) shall race alongside for the 2025 season at Kick Sauber. Arguably, the worst team of the 2024 season, Sauber, is up for a major overhaul in 2026. Hulkenberg is going to be their “numero uno” choice considering his ties with Audi. Bortoleto on the other hand needs to race consistently in order to stop himself from becoming the next Mick Schumacher.

0.title: UPS to cut sorting shift in Charlotte as more closures loom
0.snippet: The carrier is evaluating further reductions in its network as part of an efficiency push, but details are limited.
0.content:
Listen to the article 2 min This audio is auto-generated. Please let us know if you have feedback

UPS is trimming operations at a Charlotte, North Carolina, facility, and more cuts may be coming for its U.S. network.

Ninety-nine employees will be impacted by the closure of its day sortation shift at the building on West Pointe Drive, beginning May 2, according to a Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act letter filed this month.

Affected employees working on the sort include 76 part-time hourly workers, 21 part-time management employees and two full-time management workers.

"UPS will attempt to mitigate the impacts by offering work to affected employees in other positions where possible," per the WARN notice.

The cuts in Charlotte build upon sortation shift closures in several other states that UPS rolled out last year. The delivery giant is in the midst of overhauling its U.S. network, which will result in upgrades at some facilities and closures for others.

The Teamsters union Local 710 said in a February notice to members that UPS planned to close several buildings in Indiana, including three in its own jurisdiction, potentially starting in late May.

"Local 710 will be working out all the details over the coming weeks to keep our members working and fight for every member’s job," the union said.

In an email to Supply Chain Dive, a UPS spokesperson said the company is evaluating the closure of "some operations" in its network as part of an efficiency push mentioned during its January earnings call. In that call, UPS executives said multiyear "efficiency reimagined" initiatives should deliver about $1 billion in savings.

"Because the evaluation is ongoing, we do not have additional details on some specific closures," the spokesperson added.

1.title: UPS Statement on U.S. Network Optimization
1.snippet: UPS has an unwavering commitment to serving our customers around the world. As we announced in January, we are making exciting changes to optimize our...
1.content: UPS has an unwavering commitment to serving our customers around the world. As we announced in January, we are making exciting changes to optimize our network, improve efficiency and continue to deliver on our customer-first strategy. The changes underway include reassessing a small percentage of our U.S. operations. Our employees and customers remain a top priority for us during this process, and we will continue to provide industry-leading service to customers in every community we serve. We will also continue philanthropic investments through The UPS Foundation to build stronger communities, create a healthier environment and advance opportunities for all.

2.title: With tech start-ups buzzing, why are many young Chinese reluctant to dive in?
2.snippet: Government guideline seeks to encourage entrepreneurship, but many young people say starting a business is too risky in a sluggish economy.
2.content:
As governments across China roll out new measures to boost employment and entrepreneurship on the back of an AI-driven tech boom, many young people, worried that weak demand and a sluggish economy make starting a business too risky, remain drawn to stable government jobs.

Advertisement

Seven central government ministries, including the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security and the Ministry of Education, issued a joint guideline late last month urging local governments to promote employment through entrepreneurship.

The initiative targets groups with high unemployment rates, including recent university graduates, migrant workers and retired military personnel.

The guideline calls for the rapid development of specialised training programmes in emerging sectors such as the digital economy, artificial intelligence, the green economy, and the “silver-hair” economy that caters to the growing ranks of the elderly. It also emphasises enhancing entrepreneurial skills through innovative “skills + entrepreneurship” training models.

It highlights the importance of government guidance and market orientation, encouraging the flow of venture capital and other resources into business incubation platforms to foster high-quality small and medium-sized enterprises and create jobs. Financial support will be made available to university students and recent graduates who translate innovations into viable businesses.

Advertisement

President Xi Jinping emphasised the importance of the tech sector at a high-profile meeting with leading Chinese entrepreneurs in Beijing last month.
